event.title: centuries, textile mills and coal mining were important; in the early 19th century shipbuilding emerged

data.event: In the 18th and 19th centuries, textile mills and coal mining were important; in the early 19th century shipbuilding emerged as Govan's principal industry.
In 1864, Govan gained burgh status, and was Scotland's fifth largest burgh.

event.title: was incorporated into the city of Glasgow in 1912

data.event: It was incorporated into the city of Glasgow in 1912.
Two associated Christian burials are radiocarbon dated to the 5th or 6th centuries, making Govan the earliest known Christian site in the region.

event.title: 1855, an elaborately carved sandstone sarcophagus was found

data.event: In 1855, an elaborately carved sandstone sarcophagus was found during digging in the churchyard.
It is now kept inside the church.

event.title: indicates an origin in the 10th or 11th centuries

data.event: It may have been used to contain the body or relics of Constantine, although the style of carving indicates an origin in the 10th or 11th centuries.
